settings.heading: You're Taking Supplements Made For White Men. That's Why They're Not Working.

settings.heading: "Do You Use The Same Hair Products As A White Guy?"
settings.text:
Of course not.

You walk into the hair care aisle. You know exactly where to go.

You don't grab the same products white men use. Why? Because your hair is completely different. Different texture. Different needs. Different structure.

You need different products. That's just common sense.

settings.heading: What about lotion?
settings.text:
If you've got Black skin, you know you can't just use any random moisturizer.

Your skin loses water faster. You need thicker formulas. You might deal with hyperpigmentation or dark spots that need specific ingredients like vitamin C or retinoids.

White guys? Their skin is more sensitive to sun damage. Different moisture loss rates. Different concerns.

Different skin. Different products. Different ingredients.

Again - nobody questions this. It's obvious.

settings.heading: So Why The Hell Are You Taking The Same Fat-Loss Supplement As White Men?
settings.text:
Think about it.

Your hair is different. So you use different products.

Your skin is different. So you use different lotion.
Your metabolism is different too.

Your body burns calories differently. Your hormones work differently. Your body stores and burns fat differently.

So why are you using the exact same supplement formula as white men?

settings.heading: Here's The Dirty Secret The Supplement Industry Doesn't Want You To Know:
settings.text:
Every major fat-loss supplement on the market is formulated based on studies that used mostly white male participants.

They take that research. They create a formula. Then they slap a label on it and sell it to EVERYONE - including Black men - as if all bodies work the same way.

But they don't.

You wouldn't use white guy hair products. You wouldn't use white guy lotion.

So why are you taking supplements made for white guy bodies?

settings.heading: Your Body Works Completely Different
settings.description:
Just like your hair has a different texture and needs different products...

Just like your skin loses moisture differently and needs different ingredients...

Your body has a different metabolism and needs different supplements.

If you're a Black man over 30, your body has 5 major metabolic differences compared to white men:

settings.heading: Your resting metabolism burns ~5% fewer calories per day
settings.description: (That's 80 calories less every single day - just sitting still)

settings.heading: Your body burns carbs first, not fat
settings.description: (White men's bodies switch to burning fat easier. Yours doesn't - so fat stays stored)

settings.heading: Your insulin resistance is significantly higher
settings.description: (Even at the same body weight as a white man, your insulin works differently - sending stronger "store fat" signals)

settings.heading: Your cortisol rhythm is flatter
settings.description: (White men's cortisol drops at night. Yours stays elevated - triggering late-night cravings and belly fat storage)

settings.heading: Your estrogen levels are consistently higher
settings.description: (This creates stubborn "soft fat" in your chest and midsection that's nearly impossible to burn with standard supplements)

Sold out twice in 1 year

settings.heading: This Is Why Everything You've Tried Has Failed
settings.description:
You wouldn't put white guy hair products in your hair and expect good results.

You wouldn't use white guy lotion on your skin and expect it to work properly.

So why would you put white guy supplements in your body and expect them to work?

You've been following the instructions. Taking the pills. Doing the work.

But you've been using a formula designed for someone else's body.
It's like trying to use a light moisturizer when your skin needs something thicker. It's not going to work - no matter how much you apply.

Same thing here.

White men can take generic fat burners and see results because those formulas match their physiology.

But when YOU take them? The formula doesn't address:
Your slower resting burn
Your carb-first fuel preference
Your insulin resistance
Your elevated cortisol
Your higher estrogen

That's why the results are slow. Or nonexistent.

It's not you. It's the formula.

You need a formula made for YOUR body. Just like you need hair products made for YOUR hair. And lotion made for YOUR skin.

settings.label: DIFFERENCE #1
settings.heading: Black Men Burn Fewer Calories At Rest
settings.description1: Multiple studies show that Black men have a resting metabolic rate (RMR) that's approximately 5% lower than white men - even at the same age, weight, and fitness level.
settings.description2: You burn 80 fewer calories daily—2,400 monthly, or 7 pounds yearly—of fat that doesn’t get burned.
settings.description3: Generic fat burners don't account for this lower baseline. They assume everyone burns the same amount at rest.
settings.description4: Cayenne Pepper Extract and Grains of Paradise are thermogenic compounds that specifically boost your resting burn - countering this metabolic disadvantage and creative a competitive advantage for you body type.

settings.label: DIFFERENCE #2
settings.heading: Black Men Burn Carbs, Not Fat
settings.description1: Research shows Black men burn less fat and more carbs than white men. While white men’s bodies burn fat even at rest, yours keeps it locked in storage.
settings.description2: Even in a calorie deficit, your body burns carbs, not stored fat—so chest and belly fat stay.
settings.description3: Standard fat burners use caffeine or stimulants but don’t train your body to burn fat instead of carbs.
settings.description4: Grains of Paradise contains 6-paradol that activates brown adipose tissue (BAT) - literally training your body to burn fat for fuel. Clinical studies show increased fat oxidation and reduced visceral fat.

settings.label: DIFFERENCE #3
settings.heading: Black Men Have Higher Insulin Resistance
settings.description1: Even with identical weight and fat levels, Black men have higher insulin resistance, sending stronger “store fat” signals to belly and chest.
settings.description2: Eating carbs spikes insulin longer, leading to more fat storage, increased hunger, and stronger cravings every time.
settings.description3: Generic formulas ignore insulin, focusing on “boosting metabolism” while your insulin quietly works against you around the clock.
settings.description4: Dihydroberberine (GlucoVantage®) is clinically proven to improve insulin sensitivity - helping your cells respond to insulin properly so fat can be mobilized instead of stored.

settings.label: DIFFERENCE #4
settings.heading: Black Men Have A "Flat" Cortisol Curve
settings.description1: Multiple studies show that Black men have a resting metabolic rate (RMR) that's approximately 5% lower than white men - even at the same age, weight, and fitness level.
settings.description2: Even without feeling stressed, your body stays in physiological stress, promoting fat storage and making fat loss difficult.
settings.description3: They completely ignore cortisol. Some even make it WORSE by adding high doses of stimulants.
settings.description4: Ashwagandha (KSM-66®) and L-Theanine are clinically proven to reduce cortisol and restore a healthy stress rhythm - targeting the exact pattern that drives fat storage in Black men.

settings.label: DIFFERENCE #5
settings.heading: Black Men Have Higher Estrogen Levels
settings.description1: Studies show Black men have higher estrogen (estradiol) levels than white men, leading to chest and belly fat, reduced testosterone, and lower energy and motivation.
settings.description2: That "soft" fat in your chest? It's not just excess calories. It's hormonally-driven fat caused by elevated estrogen.
settings.description3: Generic fat burners ignore hormones—they may drop weight, but chest fat stays since the hormonal issue persists.
settings.description4: DIM (Diindolylmethane) helps your body metabolize excess estrogen, while Zinc and Boron support healthy testosterone production - addressing BOTH sides of the hormonal equation.

settings.label: FOR METABOLIC DISADVANTAGE
settings.heading: FOR METABOLIC DISADVANTAGE
settings.description:
Why Black Men Need This:
Your resting burn is ~5% lower than white men. Your body burns carbs first, not fat.
settings.description1: Capsaicin increases thermogenesis (heat production) in your body, directly boosting resting metabolic rate. Studies show it increases fat oxidation even when you're sitting still - countering the metabolic disadvantage Black men face.
settings.description2: Activates brown adipose tissue (BAT), which burns stored fat to produce heat. Clinical trials show it increases whole-body energy expenditure by 137 calories per day and reduces visceral fat. This directly addresses the lower resting burn and poor fat oxidation in Black men.

settings.label: FOR INSULIN RESISTANCE
settings.heading: FOR INSULIN RESISTANCE
settings.description:
Why Black Men Need This:
Even at the same body weight as white men, Black men have significantly higher insulin resistance - making fat storage more likely and fat burning harder.
settings.description1:
A highly-absorbable form of berberine that activates AMPK - the master switch for glucose metabolism. Clinical studies show:

  • 1.27 cm reduction in waist circumference
  • Improved insulin sensitivity
  • Better glucose uptake into cells (instead of fat storage)


This directly counters the insulin resistance that plagues Black men at higher rates than white men.
settings.description2: The ONLY probiotic strain with clinical evidence for reducing abdominal fat (8.5% reduction in trials). It works by improving gut health and insulin sensitivity - addressing the root cause of belly fat storage in Black men.

settings.label: FOR CORTISOL DYSREGULATION
settings.heading: FOR CORTISOL DYSREGULATION
settings.description:
Why Black Men Need This:
Black men have a "flatter" cortisol curve - meaning stress hormones stay elevated all day and into the evening. This drives cravings, fat storage, and insulin resistance.
settings.description1:
The gold-standard ashwagandha clinically proven to reduce cortisol by 27.9%. This directly restores the healthy cortisol rhythm that Black men need to:

  • Stop late-night cravings
  • Improve sleep quality
  • Reduce stress-driven belly fat storage
settings.description2: Promotes relaxation without drowsiness. Lowers heart rate and blood pressure under stress. Improves sleep quality. Works synergistically with Ashwagandha to restore the cortisol rhythm that's disrupted in Black men.
settings.description3: Reduces stress-driven emotional eating and cravings. Helps regulate mood and appetite - targeting the evening cravings driven by elevated cortisol in Black men.

settings.label: FOR HORMONAL IMBALANCE
settings.heading: FOR HORMONAL IMBALANCE
settings.description:
Why Black Men Need This:
Black men consistently have higher estrogen levels than white men - causing stubborn chest fat, low energy, and reduced testosterone.
settings.description1: Supports healthy estrogen metabolism, helping your body convert "bad" estrogen metabolites into "good" ones. Also acts as a mild aromatase inhibitor, preventing testosterone from converting into estrogen. This directly addresses the higher baseline estrogen in Black men.
settings.description2: Essential for testosterone production. Deficiency is directly linked to low testosterone. Supports healthy hormone balance - especially important as Black men experience faster age-related testosterone decline.
settings.description3: Clinical studies show it increases free testosterone while simultaneously reducing estradiol (estrogen). A one-two punch for the hormonal imbalance that creates chest fat in Black men.
settings.description4: Studied specifically for weight management in pre-obese adults. Improves metabolic disorders and insulin sensitivity - supporting the overall hormonal and metabolic reset.

settings.heading: How is this different from other fat-loss supplements?
settings.description:
Simple: Every other supplement is formulated based on white male physiology.
They use studies that primarily included white men. Then they sell that same formula to everyone.

Dryft™ is different.

Every ingredient was specifically chosen to address the 5 proven metabolic differences between Black men and white men:

1. Lower resting burn

2. Lower fat oxidation (carb-first fuel use)

3. Higher insulin resistance

4. Flatter cortisol curve

5. Higher estrogen levels

That's why other supplements failed you. And why Dryft™ works.

settings.heading: Why haven't I heard about these differences before?
settings.description:
Because the supplement industry doesn't want to invest in race-specific research. It's easier and cheaper to make one formula and sell it to everyone.

But the scientific research is clear: Black men and white men have significantly different metabolic and hormonal profiles. Ignoring those differences is why generic supplements fail.

settings.heading: I'm skeptical. How do I know this will work for me?
settings.description:
Fair question. You've been burned before.

Here's why Dryft™ is different:

1. The science is real. Every metabolic difference we mention is backed by peer-reviewed research.

2. The ingredients are clinically-dosed. We don't use "fairy dust" amounts.

3. Thousands of Black men are already seeing results (check the reviews).

4. You're protected by our 90-day guarantee. If it doesn't work, you get every penny back.


You have nothing to lose and everything to gain.

settings.heading: Will this work if I'm not working out?
settings.description:
Yes - but results will be slower.

Dryft™ fixes the metabolic issues that make fat loss hard for Black men. It will work even if you're not exercising.

However, adding even basic activity (walking, light workouts) will accelerate results significantly.

Most men see noticeable changes by week 4. Full transformation by week 12.
